reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: OMG! This book had me spellbound from the very first, intense, heart-pounding chapter. I knew I was in for a roller-coaster ride when I came to the end of those first few pages. And it didn't let up—there where multiple times that my heart was racing just like the characters' were. So intense and scary!Like a lot of other thrillers that I have read, there are so many twists and turns to the storyline, as well as being full of those characters that you aren't sure if you can trust. Who is the bad guy, and how can he really be that evil? So many questions and doubts. But Steena has woven a story that is impossible to figure out until you get to the end of this exciting story and everything you thought you knew is wrong.I love this dark side to Steena's writing that we've been seeing lately and these dark stories of hers just keep getting better and better. I can't wait to see what she comes up with next!I highly recommend The Sister Under The Stairs! If you're up for an amazing thriller, this is definitely the one you should dive into.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Read for the twists but also a cautionary tale
reviews.reviewText: Read for the twists but also for the cautionary tale. Great for bringing more light to human trafficking. Awful how much goes under our noses. Twists for not everyone is who they seem to be. I got a tad confused at times because there’s a lot of small role characters. But other times, I’m feverishly reading through pages to see what happens next. Trigger warning because of sensitive subjects but not as hard to read as some other domestic violence based books I’ve read like, BA Paris’s Behind Closed Doors book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best book I've read in a while!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. The ending was so unexpected! Eventually I knew where it was going, but I still think it was an incredible twist and story line. It's such an important story to tell too with the shape the world is in today. So many people live this everyday. This is my first 5 star read in over a month and i read around 25 books a month! Loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not what who I thought
reviews.reviewText: I love to read a book and try to figure out who did it. When I can't figure it out until towards the end, I love it. This book had me hanging on trying to figure out who it was. This would have been a 5 star for me but I wish I knew why someone kept asking for someone else and not letting Paige in on it. I feel like something was going on and it got dropped.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I work for a busy doctor's office and kept day dreaming of this book for the past 2 days while at work. Came home from work and made a quick dinner. Ate dinner while reading. Needless to say I couldn't put this book down. And the ending, OH MY GOSH. Well done!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The sister Under The Stairs
reviews.reviewText: This is an excellent book that kept me up late at night which should tell readers that it is a terrific read!I also learned about child abduction cases and what is being done to help solve them which was new to me!I enjoyed the characters so much that I would love it if the author would consider doing a sequel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Literally couldn't put this book down. Hooked from the first page.The way it ended makes me wonder if another book is in the works to continue on with some of the characters and I hope that is the case! Great book, but would never expect anything less from Mrs. Holmes! She is an amazing author and never disappoints when it comes to her work!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Too Complex and Not Worth It
reviews.reviewText: This book was annoying. The author tries to weave three stories together and basically forces them to work. It doesn’t feel natural at all. I don’t know where the under the stairs comes in. There are some deep emotions to be felt but honestly it all felt like a waste of time. I enjoyed reading it but I wouldn’t recommend it to anybody. It’s rushed at the end and very forced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A great read, insightful yet light & personalised look into human trafficking in America. Kept me guessing & changing my mind over & over. Now I'm just hoping there will be at least one more book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was my first read of Steena Holmes and I absolutely loved it, the story was great and genuinely couldnt put it down! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I felt the ending wasnt the end, like something was missing. But overall an incredible ride!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Gripped all way through right until the very end and left needing more answers. A good read that holds attention
